FuncDef: This command provides a mechanism to override the default reserved buffers for the queue. It is permissible, and possibly desirable, to oversubscribe the total CBS reserved buffers for a given access port egress buffer pool. Oversubscription may be desirable due to the potentially large number of service queues and the economy of statistical multiplexing the individual queue s CBS settings into the defined reserved total.

ParaDef.Info: The size parameter is an integer expression of the number of kilobytes reserved for the queue. If a value of 10 kbytes is desired, enter the value 10. A value of 0 specifies that no reserved buffers are required by the queue (a minimal reserved size can still be applied for scheduling purposes) The CBS maximum value used is constrained by the pool size in which the queue exists. Values-0 to 1048576 or default.
